thread.title: M4 chaos after bus bursts into flames
thread.title_full: M4 chaos after bus bursts into flames

title: M4 chaos after bus bursts into flames
text:
Bus bursts into flames on M4 causing traffic chaos Christopher Harris, The Daily Telegraph February 8, 2017 9:08am 
A bus which burst into flames in Sydney’s west has left 10 passengers in shock and caused traffic chaos. 
The bus broke down on the M4 off-ramp westbound this morning near Homebush Bay Drive at Homebush, sometime after 7am this morning. 
Commuters on their way to work were alarmed when smoke started to fill the interior of the bus. media_camera Bus driver Mark Ale-Siaa waits for his burnt out bus to be towed away from the M4 Homebush off ramp. Picture: John Grainger 
They rushed to evacuate the smoked filled bus, after the bus driver brought the bus to a halt in the middle of the off ramp. 
Plumes of thick black smoke came from the back of the bus as the incident brought traffic to a standstill. 
“The rear of bus is well alight, we have two appliances attacking that fire,” a NSW Fire and Rescue spokesperson told the Daily Telegraph soon after the fire began. media_camera The incident led to major traffic problems. Picture: John Grainger 
“There were no injuries, but 10 people evacuated off the back of the bus,” he said. 
Firefighters were hosing down the front of the bus, with massive plumes of smoke emanating from the back of the vehicle. 
All 10 commuters evacuated from the bus are safe. 
Motorists are advised to avoid the area due to heavy traffic conditions. 
The on ramp remains closed. media_camera
